data: S.E.A.S. - Study, Employment, Activities for students

The project "S.E.A.S. - Study, Employment, activities for student" originates from the synegistic collaboration between the I.T.E.T. "Leonardo da Vinci"of Milazzo, and other involved schools, training centers and assocations in the Consortium with a network of foreign partners in the countries of destination of mobility.These partners,that were identified through the support of some European platforms, such as eTwinning,will both host the 80 learners and put them in some apprenticeship programmes  in companies that operate in the same sector of their own education  before departing.
In a region such as Sicily, where despite the increase of the PIL and a growth in certain sectors such as tourism and export,the employment rate is still experiencing a slow growth and data on the poverty of the families are still worrying. In this context,the project wants to represent a piece of the mosaic of the qualitative development of excellence of the territory, i.e. of all areas affecting the spinneret of the sea,focusing on what is defined Blue Economy then. The aim is to train experts that can focus on the above-mentioned setting, creating new opportunities for innovative and sustainable growth,through new standards and best practices.It is important specifically:
To enhance skills and competencies of learners in the following sectors: tourist, commercial and nautical,in the three macro-areas of the supply-chain of the sea, to cover the needs of the professional profiles that are  required in this field and to encourage a greater extension of the Blue Economy in Sicily;Strengthen language skills; Strengthen useful knowledge for the creation of new business realities.
80 beneficiaries will be split into two flows of mobility and the mobility will affect  following countries:France,United Kingdom, Belgium and Malta,where indeed it will be possible to also improve their language skills, taking advantage of mobility in order  to learn two of the most spoken languages in the world:english and french. 
The project,which last for 24 months and it will be oriented to new graduates of Technical and Vocational Sicilian Institutes,who will have  achieved their high school degree  in the following addresses: Tourist, Hospitality and Tourism,Transportation and Logistic Commercial.The selection will take place with the support of an examination board who will evaluate the profiles of the individual at first according to what concerns both the linguistic skills and motivation. In order to draw up the final ranking  it will be necessary to involve also some foreign bodies, in order to make the choice  fall again  on  some candidates who have suitable profiles with the job opportunities offered by companies that will be identified for the internship.During the whole period of the project, all involved actors will work all together , sharing decisions,planning activities,monitoring the entire path, to reach a final evaluation, not only according to the experience of the candidates but according to the impacts too that SEAS  will have  both on them and on the territory. The project originated, in fact,from the desire to increase the opportunities for professional growth of learners through a working experience that can allow them to be in touch with the different social-cultural realities  but also with a concept of both living and working  in a different way.The intent is to let them get both a know-how and some good practices  to be internalized  and brought back when returnng in Italy,in order to use them then for their own professional future and for a greater development of the territory.
The project will have an impact not only on the current education of beneficiaries but also on the proponent and on members of the Consortium that will give life to new contacts with local and foreign companies and they will  both extend their network of schools and stimulate the staff to subscribe to European platforms in order to communicate with colleagues to share good practices and to increase the  visibility through the Erasmus mobility.
In a short term period  the project aims to generate,at least for the 70% of learners,the possibility to continue the work that  began   with the internship abroad and it wants to reserve a fast track because of searching  of employment for  beneficiaries,succeeding to ensure then some  proposals for further placements when returning from mobility abroad.
In addition,the dissemination step will alert not only the entire school community,but also families, institutions, agencies,local businesses and stakeholders,bringing the results in terms of learning outcomes and good practices in the tables of comparison and to the attention of professionals related to the world of education and vocational training, in order to match  more training courses with the labor market.

This project is intended for RTVMC students, teachers and specialists, who works with disadvantaged youth and students with special needs.
There, in Radviliskis technology and business teaching centre, learns students with light mental disorder or complex disorder, also there learns disadvantaged youth.
Many of them have learning troubles, health, behavior problems and harmful habits. All those causes increase risk of students' drop out from the school and diminish their possibilities to find job in future. Only very good vocational training can improve their future perspectives.
The goal of the project is to improve professional knowledge and working skills of students and teachers, increase learning motivation of youngsters, strengthen social competences of disadvantaged youth and students with light mental disorder, expand students outlook, increase entrepreneurship, strengthen adapting ability and future employability, and this way improve quality of vocational education.
The knowledge, working skills and international experience, gained through the project lifetime, will change youngsters approach to future job, increase chances to concur in Lithuanian and European job market, encourage their entrepreneurship.
Activities are planned for 2 years. Through this time 14 groups of students, leading by RTVMC teachers and specialists, will work in internships abroad.
82 RTVMC students of carpenter’s, inside decorator’s, hotel worker’s, cook’s, metal worker’s, auto-mechanic’ sand groom's specialty and 2 absolvents will go to internships in Germany, Italy, Spain, England, Malta, Denmark and Portugal. They will be leaded by 26 leading persons. All students will work by their specialty in SME's 3 weeks. There in Denmark students will work 5 weeks in college workshop. 
Before this internship is planned coordinating visit of 2 persons to Denmark.
8 international partners’ organizations will help to arrange training placements.
Also is planned internship visits to Italy and Malta for 6 teachers of cook’s and hotel worker’s with cooking specialties.
One more activity is arrival of 3 high qualified instructors to Radviliskis. Specialists from abroad will teach teachers and students of cook’s, hotel worker’s with cooking, carpenter’s and metal worker’s specialties. It is planned to invite teachers and students from other Lithuanian schools to those events.
RTVMC project's work group will communicate with international partners on regular basis. There will be signed International Contracts and Quality commitments for each mobility activity.
It will be signed Memorandum of Understanding with the partners, who apply ECVET.
At the time of internship will be strengthened students working skills, at the leisure time students will gain more social competences.
The students’ work quality will be evaluated by mentors from receiving organizations, by employers and by RTVMC leading persons.
After the stage students and teachers will get Europass mobility documents. Receiving organizations also will issue Certificates for internship participants.
Working with RTVMC groups, international partners also will gain new experience. 
Implementing project activities will increase quality of vocational training in Radviliskis technology and business teaching centre, as well as in partners’ organizations.
So, project will make big international impact.
There will be involved 10 partners’ organizations from 8 European countries. 
The school also going to implement wide dissemination activities, invite teachers and students from other schools and different Lithuanian regions to project’ events.

Kedainiai Vocational Training Center (Kedainiai VTC), after reviewing the international strategy of the organization, and discussing the benefits and implications of the mobility on the organization of the 2016-2017, strives for the internationalization of activities to reach evenly all staff and students of the organization. In the project application of Vocational Training Mobility Charter (Students and Staff Mobility) in 2018, we outlined the implementation of all existing mobility activities of Erasmus + KA1:
1. Short term 3-6 weeks length students’ placement in the workplace, 54 students from vocational training programs. Distribution of students according to vocational training programs:
• Professionals in the field of services (cook, waiter and bartender, hygiene cosmetics) 21students.
• Engineering and mechanics professions (welder, car mechanic) 14 students.
• Construction and architecture professions (decorator (builder)) 8 students.
• In the field of IT - computer hardware tuner, 3 students.
• Students with special needs - 8 pupils. Distribution of pupils with special educational needs according to vocational training programs: chef's vocational training program-2 students, decorator (builder) vocational training program -6 students.
2. Long term 3 months duration students’ practice in the workplace, 2 hairdresser training programs and 2 cutter-designer and modeller students.
3. Teaching / training visits, 11 participants in the project.
• 3 business enterprise participants attending the teaching assignment visit. The staff of Hotel Belcekiz Beach Club Hotel, Turkey will arrive in the Kedainiai VTC for a week on a teaching / training visit.
• 8 Kedainiai VTC staff will go to vocational training institutions in Turkey, Spain and Estonia for a week length Integrated Vocational English, Bar Work Organization, Catering and Construction Technology, Business and Administration Professional subjects teaching assignment visits. 
4. Staff mobility visits, 7 participants:
• 4 people from administrative staff will go on a week a long-term work-observation visit to the United Kingdom, Italy.
• 1 IT specialist in VET will take one-week long practice in a UK  IT company.
• 2 cook teachers will complete 9 days long working practice in a company in Turkey.
While planning Kedainiai VETC Charter application mobilities at Kedainiai VTC, we took into account international strategy and action plan changes also the assessor’s recommendations. We have included the newly introduced vocational curriculum - hygiene cosmetologist and computer hardware adjuster specialty‘s vocational teachers and students into mobility application in 2018. We also want international activities to reach the students with special educational needs or socially disadvantages students. In short-term practice, about 50% of pupils from social risk or exclusion classes will attend the workplace. Students with special needs will go to a partner organization that has experience in organizing traineeships for this target group.
An IT vocational teacher whose vocational training program is a new one at our institution and vocational education teacher need to gain practical experience in improving the curriculum and developing the learning material will attend the project. Four graduates participate in internships and they will go to ErasmusPRO 3-month practice in enterprises, before that, we will organize a pre-preparatory visit to a partner organization in Spain.
In 2017-2018 school year, Kedainiai VETC has faced the decrease of the number of students. That‘s why it won‘t be essential quantitative changes and the increase of number of participants in the implementation of the organization's internationalization strategy.
Kedainiai VETC plans to implement mobility flows to host organizations in Turkey, Germany, Spain, the United Kingdom, and Italy in 2018.  We will also organize 1 incoming mobility to Kedainiai VETC, Lithuania. The main topics that will be integrated into mobility programs are the integration of the disabled (pupils with special education needs), the needs of the labor market in the region, and integration of cultural heritage topics during training visits.
Partners have appropriate knowledge, skills, in the relevant project activities and we aim to involve the project organizations that we have already collaborated with in the previous mobility or partnership projects.
Host organizations have required Erasmus + programme vocational sector‘s implementation experience, contacts with local and regional businesses and educational, government institutions and have competent human resources, which may contribute to high quality Kėdainių VETC mobility implementation in their organizations. Partners carry on supervision of participant’s mobility in high quality, acquired skills assessment and recognition, project dissemination and assessment; organize VET learners’ placements in companies and job shadowing.
Praktinių įgūdžių ir kompetencijų tobulinimas darbo vietoje

Mazeikiai Polytechnic school gathers a significant number of newly joining students in the field of  specialties of architecture and construction, engineering, services for individuals, business and administration every year. In 2016 the school joined 460 students and 1st September the number of students increased in 925. Our school community aims the youth to learn, remain to live and work with such a number of students in Mazeikiai and its urban areas despite the birth rate is decreasing and the emigration of the country is increasing.
For the year 2017-2018 it is planned to provide the curriculum for 360 students of the II-III year of decorator (builder), welder, electrician, machinery maintenance worker, organizer of rituals and festivals, catering and accommodation service provider, cook, manager assistant of the trading company, small business coordinator and organizer of sports club activities. Firstly, it is calculated that only ten percent of the II-III year learners will perform a professional working internship in comparison with the rest four percent of the total number of school students. According to the calculations, it can be concluded, that only a few learners have the opportunity to internship in a foreign country and improve practical knowledge and competencies. Besides it is a great encouragement for such a minority number of students to raise motivation, acquire new competencies, improve linguistic skills, learn more about career experience environment and culture.
Mazeikiai District Municipality organization adjoining close cooperation with social partners who have paid a major attention recently in the interest of having even a greater encouragement to attempt our own students develop their current professional knowledge and competencies not only working in the local companies, but also encourage them to gain experience during the international internship abroad. It is necessary to provide more employment opportunities and better career prospects for students in the future, help develop initiative and entrepreneurship, improve their foreign language skills, professional and general competencies preparing students to popular specialties.
The purpose of the project is to improve practical skills and competencies, general abilities, increase initiative and entrepreneurship, seeking to reform employment opportunities integrating into the labor market.
The aims of the project are:
 - to be familiar with supervising structure of companies and principles of labor management.
 - to clarify the importance and interfaces of theoretical and practical training.
 - to improve practical skills and competencies and gain new competencies in particular  fields.
 - to raise students' motivation learning foreign languages, improve general and professional  language skills.
 - to develop socio-cultural skills: relevant communication skills, a relationship between an  employee and employer as well as teamwork aspects.
 - to raise awareness of different cultures.
The learners will perform a three week professional working internship in Germany, the United Kingdom, Portugal, Spain and Italy in small and medium-sized business companies.
The duration of the project: the professional working internship will be held in Germany and the United Kingdom for 40 learners in 2017, and in Spain, Italy and Portugal in March, 2018.
Recent expectations during the professional working internship for 40 learners:
 - will improve the knowledge gained at school, develop professional skills and competencies in the fields of decorator (builder), welder, electrician, machinery maintenance worker, catering and accommodation service provider, cook, manager assistant of the trading company, small business coordinator, organizer of rituals and festivals and organizer of sports club activities.
 - will access to modern technologies, achieve new professional knowledge and practical skills.
 - will develop social skills: relevant communication skills, a relationship between an employee and employer as well as teamwork aspects.
 - will learn more about the culture and develop linguistic skills in the United Kingdom, Germany, Spain, Italy and Portugal.
 - the participants of the project will prepare presentations on business topic "Professional development at work" about the United Kingdom, Germany, Spain, Italy and Portugal presenting entire material to school community the final at an event Practical skills and competency development, based on international experience".
Informacinių technologijų specialistų profesinių kompetencijų tobulinimas

The rapid development of service centers and start-up information technology companies in Lithuania gives the impression that number of people working in this field is growing fast, and our country has become a breeding ground for such specialists. However the reality is a little different – the percentage of Lithuanian information and communication technology professionals  among total employed in the country is only 2.1 percent  by 2016 statistic. The main reason of the limiting growth of Lithuanian IT sector is notable shortage of IT specialists. It is obvious that any new qualified IT professional will get the job offer, and only from his competence and the choice will depend on what company and the position he chooses. There is no doubt that digitalization will have an increasing impact on business IT solutions that help simplify and speed up the work, and also will more and more replaced with common tasks. Lithuania strategic target is to arrange the labor market strategy of the IT specialists to grow much faster, as it should be seen as a simple and straight path to increase the country's economic well-being.
Given the Lithuanian labor market trends and developments of Visaginas strategy - to become the IT center of Lithuania - we strive to develop information technology professions in our center. Our experience shows that in order to make a good IT specialist, the students must gain not only practical knowledge, also assure that students will get practical training skills with innovative equipment, programs, IT solutions. We sure, that the last phase of training should be practice in enterprises in Lithuania and foreign countries , because for students it is very important to know the real world of work, to get acquainted with the working methods of the specifics of access to cultural differences. On the other hand, the quality of education for the students depends on the teacher's profession knowledge and requires for VET teachers to constantly improve their qualifications, to use only the most modern methods of learning, and try as often as possible to improve the content of training programs to meet labour market needs. 
So this main purpose of this project - to increase the internship opportunities for the student information technologies VET programmes and for VET teachers, thus acquiring the professional skills necessary for successful integration into the labour market. Project participants - 36 IT students , who will participate in internship in Germany, Austria, Portugal and England and 6 VET teachers, who will participate in one week job observation in Germany and Portugal.
Project participants will have an internship IT enterprises for 3 -week internship program, o VET teachers – one week job observation programme. Participants will become familiar with the working methods, and professional specifics of the work from the inside , will get to know how to work in team , learn the impact of their work to the company's activities . They will also have the opportunity to work with the new equipment, devices. All internship participants will receive Europass mobility documents, internship will be accepted as part of vocational training and for teachers – as qualification development courses. Impact for target groups (companies): better - prepared with practical experience in foreign companies and training centers students - potential employees, which do not require additional training from the company's funds, better offer of the engineering and business professionals in the labour market.

This project will provide an opportunity for students to have their practice in a real work places at foreign companies, both to obtain new skills and improve professional and common competences they already have. Those internships promote the entrepreneurship of participants, encourage them to run their own business by applying the business ideas and innovation in Lithuania they get acquainted with during the internship.

PARTICIPATING ORGANISATIONS
Aukštadvaris Agricultural School (Lithuania), Idea-M (United Kingdom), Wisamar Bildungsgesellschaft gemeinnuetzige GmbH (Germany), IME (Malta) AMFI Agenzia per la Mobilità e la Formazione Internazionale (Italy).

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS: II-III course students of small business services provider, vehicles’ business employee (auto-mechanic) and cook professions.

PROJECT’S DURATION: 2018 06 01 – 2019 05 31. It is planned to have 4 internships: to Germany, United Kingdom, Italy and Malta. Total number of participants is 32 students and 4 accompanying persons.

PROJECT’S MAIN GOAL: to provide an opportunity for students to have the internship in foreign companies and obtain new and practical skills and competences.

OTHER OBJECTIVES
1. to help participants to acquire specific professional competences
2. to educate and initiate the entrepreneurship, initiative skills and creativity of participants
3. to enlarge the occupation and employment possibilities in labor market for participants and to improve the perspectives of their career
4. to educate participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures and tolerance, to raise the level of participants’ self-confidence, self-esteem and sociability
5. to improve participants’ foreign language and communicative skills

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
• Completed 4 internships based on the internship programs (32 participants).
• Acquired internship’s Europass Mobility documents, certificates of hosting organizations by 32 participants.
• Submitted the reports of internships by 32 participants.
• Raised the level of the participants’ professional competences according to the professional requirements.
• Raised the level of participants’ self-confidence, initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness.
• Improved participants’ practical skills, giving better employability opportunities in both Lithuanian and European labor markets.
• Improved language and communication skills of participants.

As the evaluation of acquired and improved skills, every participant will acquire such documents: Europass Mobility Document, certificate of AŽŪM and certificate of hosting organizations.

DISSEMINATION: articles in regional newspaper and web-pages of participating organizations, posts in participating organizations’ Facebook pages, informational stand, booklet about project, presentations of the internships, informal environment.
Praktinių įgūdžių tobulinimas pagal darbo rinkos poreikius

PROJECT’S CONTEXT
KTVM has interviewed the employers, who collaborate with school, after that the trends of catering and building sectors’ markets have been identified. In accordance to the curriculum of the cook-waiter and builder-construction finisher professions, it has been invested into these topics insufficiently, students do not have as much knowledge and ability as the employers require.

PROJECT’S OBJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: to improve both practical skills and abilities of cook–waiter and builder-construction finisher professions students in order to have their match with the today’s labor market trend.
Other objectives:
1.to broaden specific practical skills and abilities of cook–waiter profession students with the following competences:
•to be able to prepare traditional Italian dishes, be able to serve them to a table (in Italy)
•to be able to prepare take-away suitable meals and serve them to customers (in United Kingdom)
•to be able to prepare meals containing components of fish or seafood, to be able to serve tables for fish or seafood dishes (in Malta)
2.to broaden specific practical skills and abilities of builder-construction finisher profession students with the following competences:
•to be able to plaster using lightweight plasters, to warm the buildings (United Kingdom)
•to be able to install the gypsum systems and partitions for wet rooms, to do the decoration bathroom and kitchen (in Malta)
3.to improve the skills of participants’ foreign language
4.to raise the level of participants’ main competences and skills, to increase participants’ entrepreneurship and understanding of the catering and building businesses
5.to educate European values for participants: tolerance, intercultural awareness and understanding, sociability, initiative and self-sufficiency

AMOUNT AND BACKGROUND OF PARTICIPANTS
Project’s participants: second – third course students of the cook–waiter and builder-construction finisher profession.
It is planned to have such compositions of students for the internships: 6 students of the cook–waiter profession to Italy, 4 students of the cook–waiter and 4 students of the builder-construction finisher to United Kingdom; 6 students of the cook–waiter and 4 students of the builder-construction finisher to Malta respectively, 24 students and 3 accompanying persons in total.
Hosting organizations: Idea-M (United Kingdom), AMFI (Italy), IME (Malta).

ACTIVITIES
•to perform the selection of participants for internships
•to implement the linguistic, cultural and professional preparation of participants as prescribed in an application
•to organize the internships as prescribed in an application
•to sign the agreements with hosting partners, project‘s participants and accompanying persons
•to implement all planned internships
•to submit the reports in the Mobility Tool
•to organize the presentations of internships and evaluate its participants
•to fully implement the planned dissemination of the project
•to make a final assessment of the project
•to submit a final report of poject in Mobility Tool

PROJECT’S RESULTS
Quantitative results:
•Implemented 3 internships in United Kingdom, Italy, Malta, total 24 students
•Implemented presentations of 3 internships in United Kingdom, Italy, Malta, submitted 24 reports of participants
•24 participants of internships have obtained documents of Europass Mobility program and certificates from hosting partners
Qualitative results:
•Participants raised the level of main competences, which meet the requirements of labor market of catering and building sectors, improved career opportunities
•Participants improved their language and communicational skills
•Participants took European values such as: tolerance, intercultural awareness and understanding, sociability, initiative and self-sufficiency

IMPACT
Expected impact for participants:
•The main impact for participants: in order to have the match of the practical skills and abilities of the cook–waiter and builder-construction finisher professions students with the today’s labor market trend, the participants during the internships will acquire the competences, which are described in project’s goals
•Improved foreign languages skills
•Raised the level of participants’ main competences and skills
•Obtained the certificates of completed internship
•Acquired European values such as: tolerance, intercultural awareness and understanding, sociability, initiative
Expected impact for school:
•Improved vocational training process by educating students’ professional competences, which meet requirements of catering and building businesses labor market
•Implement European mobility goals from schools strategic planning
•Improved management and organizational skills of responsible persons
•Developed international cooperation, good practice and distribution of competences between participating institutions
•Developed the cooperation between educational institutions and business enterprises

PARTICIPANTS
Project’s participants: vocational training second – third course students of the cook–waiter profession.
Project’s duration: 2017 06 01 – 2018 05 31, total 12 months. There will be three internships to Malta, United Kingdom and Italy. Total number of participants – 24 and 3 accompanying teachers.

PARTNERS
Consortium composition: Kaisiadorys School of Business and Technology (coordinator), Elektrenai Vocational Training Centre, Aukstadvaris Agricultural School, Veisiejai School of Business and Technology.
Hosting organizations: IZI Ltd. (Malta), Idea-M (United Kingdom), AMFI Agenzia per la Mobilità e la Formazione Internazionale (Italy).

OBJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: to improve vocational skills, specific professional and main common competences in a real work place of cook–waiter profession students.

Other objectives:
1. to educate specific professional competences of the participants:
• to be able to prepare traditional Italian dishes, be able to serve them to table (in Italy)
• to be able to prepare take-away suitable meals and serve them to customers (in United Kingdom)
• to be able to prepare meals containing fish or seafood, be able to serve tables for fish or seafood dishes (in Malta)

2. to raise the level of participants’ main competences and skills, especially taking into consideration their correspondence to catering sector and labour market;
3. to encourage participants’ entrepreneurship in the field of food preparation and serving, to educate abilities to work in business environment and various situations, to increase initiative skills and self-sufficiency;
4. to raise the level of participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures, sociability and tolerance;
5. to improve participants’ foreign language skills.

REQUIREMENTS
Professional:
• to acquire specific professional competences;
• to raise the level of main professional skills and competences, especially taking into consideration their correspondence to catering sector and labour market;
• to acquire better occupation and employment opportunities, to improve perspectives of future career;
• to acquire entrepreneurship skills in catering sector, to acquire skills how to work in business environment, how to act in various situations and to increase initiative skills and self-sufficiency.
• to introduce with business organizing, activities schedule making, work culture;

Individual:
• to improve foreign language skills;
• to educate communicational skills in foreign environment;
• to raise self-esteem and self-confidence;
• to raise the level of cultural awareness and understanding, sociability and tolerance;
• to get familiar with foreign culture, broaden cultural outlook and number of professional contacts.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
• Completed professional training under the internship program of 24 participants
• Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates–Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations
• Made reports of internships of 24 participants
• Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements
• In a real work places improved main practical skills of participants giving better integration possibilities in labour markets
• Improved language and communicational skills of the participants
• Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
As the evaluation of acquired and improved skills, every participant will acquire:
• Europass
• Certificate of hosting organizations

IMPACT
Main impact of the project: during the internships in the real work places cook–waiter profession students will improve their vocational skills, specific professional and main common competences.

Other impact:
• Participating organisations will increase the level of international collaboration between educational organisations;
• Consortium schools will be able to suggest competitive learning conditions;
• Employees of consortium and hosting partners will improve their organisational competences, acquire international management skills and good practices of their colleagues.
• Acquired experience will lead to better implementation of this and upcoming projects.

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination main goal: to introduce target groups with project’s implementation, its goals, activities and results, to spread positive EU support possibilities and encourage people‘s tolerance, cultural awareness and understanding.
Methods of project’s dissemination: stands, articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, social network Facebook, booklets about project, presentations of the internships.

PROJECT’S PARTICIPANTS: vocational training second-third course students of builder – constructions finisher, interior decorator and electro-technician professions.

PROJECT’S PARTNERS
1. Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre (coordinator)
2. Kaišiadorys School of Business and Technology
3. Veisiejai School of Business and Technology
4. Wisamar (Germany)
5. Idea-M (United Kingdom)
6. IZI Ltd. (Malta)

PROJECT’S MAIN GOAL
To educate and improve practical skills, specific vocational and main common competences of building services sector students during the real workplaces internships.

OTHER OBJECTIVES
1. to educate the following specific professional competences of participants;
- for builders – constructions finishers: to be able to renovate exterior buildings’ walls and do restoration works; to be able to do interior renovation and conservation works, to know methods of restoration.
- for interior decorators: to be able to decorate small spaces; to know how to use ceramic and stone-made bricks in the decoration of interior.
- for electro-technicians: to know how to install and maintain electricity system’s protection against surge and fluctuation of voltage; to be able to install electricity installation in areas of high humidity.
2. to educate new general professional competences in a real workplaces and improve the ones already acquired, especially taking into consideration their contribution to labour market of today;
3. to raise the level of participants’ self-confidence, self-esteem and sociability, to educate participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures and tolerance;
4. to create the environment, where participants could acquire entrepreneurship and initiative skills, self-sufficiency and abilities to work in business and different situations;
5. to improve participants’ foreign language and communicative skills in foreign environment, team-work abilities.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
•Completed professional training of 24 students under the internship programs in 3 EU countries
•Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator (24 participants)
•Made reports of the internships of 24 participants
•Organised presentations of the internships (after each internship)
•Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements
•In real workplaces improved practical skills of participants giving better integration possibilities into labour markets
•Improved language and communication skills of participants
•Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, initiative skills, entrepreneurship, sociability as well as tolerance and cultural awareness

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
•Europass mobility document
•Certificate of hosting organization
•Certificate of internship’s recognition by EPMC

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination main goal: to introduce target groups with project’s implementation, its goals, activities and results, to spread positive EU support possibilities and encourage people‘s tolerance, cultural awareness and understanding.

Methods of project’s dissemination: stands, articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, booklets about project, presentations of the internships and consideration of project’s results.

IMPACT
Main impact for participants: building services sector students will improve practical skills, specific vocational and main common competences during the real workplaces internships.

Other impact:
•Real workplace practice will improve participants’ entrepreneurship, initiative skills, self-sufficiency and abilities to adjust to labour market in any country.
•Participants will acquire Europass, which is recognized in whole EU.
•Participants will improve their foreign language and communicational skills in foreign environment.
•Participants will improve their sense of self-confidence and feel themselves stronger psychologically before entering labour market.
•While living abroad during the internship, participants will acquire awareness and understanding of other cultures, will increase sociability and tolerance.

Participating organizations will raise the level of international collaboration between educational institutions, improve process of vocational training. Organizations’ staff will acquire international management skills, get familiar with good practices of the partners. Project’s implementation will raise the motivation of VET students to achieve better learning outcomes and diminish number of early school leavers.

PROJECT’S DURATION
2017 06 01–2018 05 31, total 12 months. There will be three internships: to Germany. United Kingdom and Malta. Total number of participants – 24 students and 3 accompanying persons.

PARTICIPANTS
Project participants – graduates of auto-technician, builder, cook-waiter, small business services provider, secretary and electro-technician professions.
Project’s duration: 2018 06 01 – 2019 05 31, total 12 months. There will be three internships: to United Kingdom, Malta and Italy. Total number of participants – 22 graduates.

PARTNERS
Consortium composition: Aukštadvaris Agricultural School (coordinator), , Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre, Veisiejai School of Business and Technology.
Hosting partners: Idea-M (United Kingdom), IME. (Malta), AMFI (Italy)

OBJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: in order to increase employment opportunities and competitiveness at the labor market, to provide graduates with the possibilities to acquire real work place experience, practical professional skills and competences. 

Other objectives:
•to educate the following specific professional competences of participants:
-for auto-technicians: to be able to maintain chassis and steering systems of right-side steering model cars’ (in United Kingdom)
-for builders: to be able to do buildings’ renovation works, to know the methods of restoration (in United Kingdom)
- for cooks-waiters: to be able to make dishes, containing seafood, serve them properly to customers (in Italy)
- for small business services providers: to be able to organize small business for tourism, communicate with clients (in Italy)
- for secretaries: to be able to serve customers in English properly and communicate with international clients, administer company’s social networks (in Malta)
- for electro-technicians: to be able to install electricity installation in areas of higher humidity, its protection against fluctuation of voltage (in Malta)
•Try to achieve better employment opportunities of participants, improve their career prospects
•In real work places improve graduates’ skills and competences, especially taking into consideration their contribution to labor market of today
•Try to achieve that real work experience and acquired competences will be acknowledged in whole EU
•To raise the level of participants’ self-confidence, to educate participants’ awareness and understanding of other cultures and tolerance
•To create the environment, where participants could acquire entrepreneurship and initiative skills, self-sufficiency, abilities to work in business and different situations
•To improve participants’ foreign language and communicative skills in foreign environment, team-work abilities

IMPACT
Impact for 22 participants: during the internships graduates will acquire real work place experience, will increase their employment opportunities and competitiveness in the labor market and will acquire professional competences.
Participants will improve their foreign language skills, team work abilities, raise the level of self-confidence.

Long lasting impact for 3 consortium schools: dissemination about the project will assist in attracting new students; schools would provide students with better learning conditions, improve vocational training process with opportunities to gain real work experience.
Long lasting impact for 3 hosting organizations: successful implementation of the project will approve for future projects, will assist in attracting inters for practice at their countries.
Extra impact: internships’ opportunities, positive feedback of participants and presentations of the internships will increase the studying motivation of younger students, will help to achieve better learning outcomes, reduce the level of early school leaving.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
•Completed professional training under the internship programs (3 internships, total 22 participants)
•Acquired real work experience
•Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates (total 22 participants) – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and AŽŪM
•Made reports of internships (by all 22 participants)
•Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements
•In real workplaces improved practical skills of participants giving better integration possibilities into labor markets
•Improved language and communication skills of participants
•Raised level of participants’ self-confidence, tolerance and cultural awareness

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
As the evaluation of acquired and improved skills, every participant will acquire:
•Europass
•Certificate of hosting organizations
•Certificate of AŽŪM

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination main goal: to introduce target groups with project’s implementation, its goals, activities and results.
Methods of project’s dissemination: stands, regional newspapers, web-pages of consortium a hosting organizations, Facebook, presentations of the internships.

PROJECT’S CONTEXT
According to EU statistics, Lithuanians are not tolerant to foreigners. Besides, 31 % of students suffer from sneering in schools in Lithuania and this is the first place in the whole EU. One quarter of sneering is due to nationality/ethnic identity, another quarter is due to improper speech in the Lithuanian language (if it is not native). This is the reason of the lower students‘ motivation. The national composition of consortium schools’ districts is heterogeneous, and this is reflected in the schools, in which the discrimination, sneering and ethnic conflicts are visible.

PROJECT’S OBJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: to improve the qualification and abilities of training specialists to work in classes, which consist of different nationalities students, to fight against discrimination, sneering and ethnic conflicts.
Other objectives:
•To educate teaching specialists’ abilities of classes management, skills of recognition and solving the problematic situations related to ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination
•To educate participants’ competences to integrate immigrants and refugees into the learning process and schools’ community
•To improve participants’ skills of educational, psychological and communication with students, especially teaching in classes, which consist of different nationalities students, to get acquainted with motivation methods of students
•To raise the level of participants’ intercultural awareness, understanding, tolerance and sociability as well as to learn the way how to impart those values to students
•To acquire skills and knowledge of individualization of education process, to raise general level of competences

AMOUNT AND BACKGROUND OF PARTICIPANTS
Project’s participants: training specialists of consortium schools, teaching classes with students of national minorities.
It is planned to have an equal partnership in this project: 8 training specialists from each consortium school, 24 training participants in total.
Consortium composition: Kaišiadorys School of Business and Technology (coordinator), Aukštadvaris Agricultural School, Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre.
Hosting organizations: Wisamar (Germany), AMFI (Italy), IZI (Malta), Idea-M (United Kingdom).

ACTIVITIES
•to perform the selection of participants for internships
•to complete the participants’ preparation of activities as prescribed in an application
•to organize the internships as prescribed in an application
•to sign the agreements with the both consortium‘s and hosting partners, project‘s participants
•to implement all planned internships
•to submit the reports in the Mobility Tool
•to organize the presentations of internships and evaluate its participants, to give the recognition documents
•to fully implement the planned dissemination
•to make a final assessment of the project
•to submit a final report of project in Mobility Tool system

PROJECT’S RESULTS
Quantitative results:
•Implemented 4 internships in Germany, Italy, Malta and United Kingdom, total 24 participants
•24 participants of internships obtained documents of Europass Mobility and certificates from hosting partners and project coordinator
•Submitted 24 reports of participants
•Implemented presentations of each internships in all consortium’s schools after every completed internship
Qualitative results:
•Raised the qualification of participants according to their professional needs (evaluating during the presentations of internships and after analysis of reports)
•Created a more tolerant learning environment, decreased the amount of ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination in consortium schools (evaluating during the long period implementing surveys of teachers and students in schools about racism, sneering and discrimination)

EXPECTED IMPACT
During the internships teachers from consortium schools will improve their qualification and abilities to work in classes, which consist of different nationalities students, and to fight against discrimination, sneering and ethnic conflicts.
During the internship the participants will observe theoretical and practical classes. The participants will improve their educational, psychological and communication skills with students, will improve the teaching and management skills of problematic situations in classes with national minorities students. The participants will learn modern working methods by individualizing the process of vocational training, will establish contacts with foreign colleagues, with whom will be able to consult, change good practices after the end of the project.
LONG TERM IMPACT
A more tolerant learning environment will: improve the relationships between students and teachers; help to individualize the teaching process and to achieve better learning results for students; increase the attractiveness of vocational education; reduce early school leaving due to the discrimination, racist and sneering environment in schools; attract more new students to schools.

PARTICIPANTS
Project’s participants: training specialists of participating vocational training schools.
Project’s duration: 2017 06 01 – 2018 05 31, total 12 months. There will be four internships to United Kingdom, Germany, Italy and Spain. Total number of participants - 24.

PARTNERS
Consortium composition: Aukštadvaris Agricultural School (coordinator), Kaišiadorys School of Business and Technology, Elektrėnai Vocational Training Centre, Šilutė Agricultural School.
Hosting partners: Wisamar Bildungsgesellschaft gemeinnuetzige GmbH (Germay), Idea-M (United Kingdom), AMFI Agenzia per la Mobilità e la Formazione Internazionale (Italy), ESMOVIA-Sistema Practices s.l. (Spain).

OJECTIVES
Project’s main goal: to improve educational, psychological, lectures giving and class management abilities of training specialists on purpose to encourage tolerance and fight against sneering, discrimination and ethnic conflicts at schools.

Other objectives:
• To educate participants’ abilities objectively manage problem situations in classes, related to ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination issues;
• To improve participants’ educational, psychological and communication with students skills, especially teaching national minorities students, immigrants,  trying to achieve better motivation and their learning outcomes;
• To educate participants’ competences to teach and to integrate immigrants and refugees into the learning process and schools’ community;
• To raise participants’ sociability, cultural awareness, understanding and tolerance, which their would be able to impart to the students;
• To acquire modern vocational training methods individualizing vocational training process, to raise general level of participants’ qualification.

PARTICIPANTS REQUIREMENTS
1. Professional:
• To acquire skills how objectively manage problem situations in classes, related to ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination issues;
• To improve participants’ lessons giving and groups’ management skills in classes, where are national minorities students, acquire skills to work with such students;
• To acquire competences to teach and to integrate immigrants and refugees into the learning process and schools’ community;
• To become more sociable and tolerant, improve cultural awareness and understanding, learn how to impart that for students;
• To acquire modern vocational training methods individualizing vocational training process, to raise general level of qualification.
• To improve educational, psychological and communication with students skills, especially teaching national minorities students, immigrants;

2. Individual:
• To improve foreign language skills;
• To educate communicational skills in foreign environment, broaden cultural outlook and number of professional contacts;
• To get familiar with foreign culture;
• To enhance motivation for further improvement.

EVALUATION DOCUMENTS
Acquired skills and competences of participants will be acknowledged with:
• Europass Mobility Documents
• Certificates of Hosting organisations
• Certificate of AŽŪM

IMPACT
Main impact of the project: during the lectures observation activities participants will improve their educational, psychological, lectures giving and class management abilities on purpose to encourage tolerance and fight against sneering, discrimination and ethnic conflicts at schools.

This project will fight against ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination issues. Project’s implementation will promote unity and European sense of the Lithuanian society, will help to solve problems, related to disjuncture of national minorities, especially taking into consideration unstable geopolitical situation and refugees crisis in the EU.

DISSEMINATION
Project’s dissemination main goal: to introduce target groups with project’s implementation, its goals, activities and results, encourage tolerance, cultural awareness and understanding of people, spread European values and positive EU support possibilities.
Methods of project’s dissemination: articles in web-pages and regional newspapers, posts at Facebook, stands and booklets about project, presentations of the internships and consideration of project’s results.

EXPECTED PROJECT’S RESULTS
• Completed 4 qualifying internships under the internships’ programs (24 participants).
• Acquired internship’s evaluation certificates for 24 participants – Europasses, certificates of hosting organizations and project’s coordinator.
• Made reports of internships (24 participants).
• Organised presentations at every Consortium school after the each internship.
• Raised level of the participants’ professional competences according to their professional requirements.
• Created more tolerant learning environment, diminished level of ethnic conflicts, sneering and discrimination at Consortium schools.
BENCHMARKING INOVATIV IN INVATAMANTUL TEHNOLOGIC SI TURISM PENTRU O COOPERARE EUROPEANA DURABILA

The project with the title "Innovative Benchmarking in Techological Education and Tourism for a Sustainable European Cooperation" is a Erasmus+ KA1 and VET mobility project for students and staff which contributes to the objectives of the Action Programme of the EU on training and provides the European dimension of education, corresponding to the national priority in order to ensure the access to quality education in initial vocational training, while at regional level is correlated with the priority of ensuring transparency of qualifications and promotes the European mobilities.The AIM of the project results from a real need for training the high school students from 10th and 11th grade from the Technological specialization, Services profile, ‚Tourism and catering’ domain, with the qualifications "Hotel worker" and "Technician in tourism", providing an initial training correlated with the Romanian and European employers' expectations from tourism. The project also satisfies the need to apply our high school’ in-service (continous) training policy of the high school teachers specialized on VET to ensure the European dimension of the technological education.The OBJECTIVES of the project are: a) General: -international cooperation for innovation and sharing the best practices for technological education; -developing cooperation in the European education and training of studentsb) Specific: b.1.) specific for students: Formation of core competencies transition from school to work and teamwork, specific skills to provide quality hotel services and achieving the technical operations of the travel agency, cross-curricular skills : communicating in a language Stain and digital;-forming the behavior based on respect and hospitality tailored to the expectations of European tourists;-forming a positive attitude in order to improve the quality in technological educationb.2.) specific for teachers:- improving the professional skills capacity for analysis and synthesis of technological education in the European context;-applying new methods and tools to increase the quality of European Benchamarking in the technological education;-developing skills to use ICT, communication in a foreign language; adapting to the European organizational culture, work in an international team.The target group consists of 28 students from 10th and 11th grade with the qualification: ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers specialized on VET education who teach in the high school and post secondary school.MOBILITYFlow I: 6 specialist teachers from the high school, Job Shadowing, April 2nd-8th, 2017 -Helsinki, Finland, partner organization-EUNEOSFlow II: 14 students, qualification ‚Technician in tourism’; June 4th -24th, 2017-Portsmouth, United Kingdom, partner organization - Traning Vision LtD.Flow III: 4 teachers specialists at the post-secondary school, Job Shadowing,Aprilie 3rd- 20, 2018 -Nancy, France; School partner Frederic ChopinFLOW IV: 14 students qualifying hotel worker, 17iunie-July 7, 2018, Rimini, Italy organization partner -Sistema Turismo PROJECT ACTIVITIES:-Information in two meetings, announcement on the board with projects;-Selection of beneficiars based on the following criteria: 10th grade or 11th student, technological high school, Services profile, basic training field - Tourism; or teachers -specialists in the Technological education area who have not benefited of a Erasmus+ scholarship;submitting a complete application file; selection tests: test of knowledge and test in the foreign language;-Pedagogical preparation -6hours / flow; Linguistic preparation in the country for English / French / Italian, 20 hours on for the teachers’ flows and 35 hours for the students’s flow; Cultural and pedagogical preparation -8hours in the country and 10hours  abroad for students, 4 hours for teachers;-Monitoring the mobilities by observing, advice, satisfaction questionnaires, diaries, filling in of practice and individual reports- Initial/during/final evaluation of the participants in mobility using tests, work samples-Certification, validation of the results by the foreign partners and Sc.Sup.Com.N.Kretzulescu- Dissemination locally, regionally, nationally and internationally through mass media, meetings of methodical committees, symposia, fairs of training firms, workshops, the following results: 28 students with upper level professional standards skills for the qualifications ‚Hotel worker’ and ‚Technician in tourism’ and 10 teachers with improved professional skills in order to increase the quality of the technological education, obtaining for each beneficiary of the Europass,of the participation and foreign language certificates, 38 portfolios of mobility, 20 new teaching materials using ICT, a methodological guide for increasing the quality of technogical education, a CD with videos, with modern teaching activities, the project website, a partners’ network.

Data explosion on the web, fuelled by social networking, micro-blogging, as well as crowdsourcing, has led to the Big Data phenomenon. This is characterized by increasing volumes of structured, semi-structured and unstructured data, originating from sources that generate them at an increasing rate. This wealth of data provides numerous new analytic and business intelligence opportunities to various industry sectors. Therefore, more and more industry sectors are in need of innovative data management services, creating a demand for Data Scientists possessing skills and detailed knowledge in this area. Ensuring the availability of such expertise will prove crucial if businesses are to reap the full benefits of these advanced data management technologies, and the know-how accumulated over the past years by researchers, technology enthusiasts and early adopters.

The European Data Science Academy (EDSA) will establish a virtuous learning production cycle whereby we: a) analyse the required sector specific skillsets for data analysts across the main industrial sectors in Europe; b) develop modular and adaptable data science curricula to meet these needs; and c) deliver training supported by multiplatform and multilingual learning resources based on our curricula. The curricula and learning resources will be continuously evaluated by pedagogical and data science experts during both development and deployment.

The primary aim of the project is to take into consideration all the requirements of the contemporary job market, and based on that to improve the  vocational and linguistic training of our students, and to strengthen their professional competence and specific linguistic competence - skills of effective communication, and the usefulness and uniqueness for the modern European job market.
Important objective and at the same time big challenge for us this year is to prepare and establish new   FEC - Further Education College, innovate school educational programme and also studying adjust to labour market. 

The experience with the employability of our students suggests us, that  youth has increasing problems with finding suitable jobs. The activities of our institution in cooperation with real firms, the experience form the subject training company, and the experience acquired from international fairs of training firms indicate the need for new, progressive and innovative methods of education based on the needs of Slovak and European job market. These methods emphasise the practical understanding, next to textbooks, they implement real situations from real life.       

Our vision is to recreate and improve the students' profile with professional and linguistic knowledge within four years, which follows the needs of the modern European job market. The basic tool for this change is the new and updated school educational program, which takes into consideration these requirements and also this year there is a possibility to complete vocational education by studying at FEC - Further Education College. 
 We would like to concentrate on the multicultural differences within Europe by learning about them, and trying to understand and accept them.

From the perspective of the students' training the aims of our project are:
-to introduce to the students the departments of the firms, and the agenda of each department
-to enable students to consult with the professional workforce and with the management
-to introduce to the students the work of the marketing department (marketing research, contact with clients, the preparation of catalogues and promotion materials, data processing, PR, the preparation and realization of meetings)
- to introduce to the students the work of the HR department (training of the employees, types of contracts and  agreements, benefits, recruiting, job interviews, the preparation of a professional CV)
-to introduce to the students the work of the economic department (budgeting, bookkeeping ,bookkeeping, reporting, statistics 
- to enable students and the employees to improve their communicative competence and professional vocabulary in English

We planned our mobilities as follows:
a/ students of the study field business academy - bilingual studies  - 10 students travel for three weeks to London, the mobility will take place either in May/June 2018.
b/  students of the study field business academy  - 10 students travel for three weeks to London, their mobility will take place  in May/June 2018
c/ managers (headmaster and 2 deputy headmasters - they travel for three days in different terms to Ostrava, their mobility will take place  from  October 2017 to March 2018.

EUROPEAN TEACHING Project it is the result of the internationalization strategy of the FBCNFP and the city of Barcelona on order to reinforce the quality, the internationalization and the innovation in Vocational Training across developing actions focused in the teachers of the VET schools for Barcelona.

The main goal of the training consortium coordinated by FBCNFP it is to improve the training and the teaching quality of the VET schools of Barcelona across developing training periods in another European VET schools. The project also pretends to generate a positive impact increasing and diversifying the experience of the VET professionals and fostering the European identity of the Vocational training to stimulate training or work mobility in the near future.  At same time, the project also pretends to foster the skills and knowledge of the professionals of the vocational training in those fields more representative for the city of Barcelona. 

The consortium focuses their main activity in mobility actions for teachers and VET professionals and also pretends to increase the proposal for students and VET schools in the participation in European projects.  Likewise, FBCNFP has the aim to remain being the reference institution of Barcelona in relation with educational European projects. 

With the implementation of this project, a total among of 28 VET teachers will acquire more professional experience that will benefit the pedagogical quality of the city. The training will be of 3 days inside Vet schools of different European countries.
Training in Europe to increase life skills and Employability of VET learNers

The project "Training in Europe to increase to life skills and Employability of VET learners" (VET-TEEN) is presented by a consortium made up of public inter-VET: IISS Carlo Alberto Dalla Chiesa (Montefiascone), IIS Stendhal (Civitavecchia) and ISIS Francesco Orioli (Viterbo), in partnership with 13 companies and intermediary training from five countries in Europe (UK, Malta, Spain, France and Ireland). The Institutes, supported by the stakeholders of the various areas involved, have built a Consortium with the primary purpose of creating a permanent placement service within schools, to accompany the students in the labour market through an international internship and certification of skills acquired. The context in which is born the project proposal consists of territories linked by a territorial continuity, with a shared history that refers to the ancient Etruria, as well as a touristic vocation. VET-TEEN aims to achieve the following objectives:1) increase the human capital of students and create more opportunities for employment, allowing continuous learning experience2) create a real placement service with the intention to reduce the time of entry into the world of work and increase the chances of finding a job in line with the studies carried out, affecting the containment of job mismatch3) spread the use of Europass and the use of EQARF indicators, to promote the development of mobility in the EU and ensure the legibility and visibility of qualifications and skills acquired, by increasing quality and transparency.The target group of beneficiaries is represented by the students of class III and IV of the three institutions, with the following broad professional specialization:Technical for TourismCAT - Construction Environment and TerritoryMaintenance and Technical SupportCommercial Services / Administration, Finance and MarketingHealth and Social ServicesTextile production- fashionall united by a personal background similar in age and degree of maturity reached and a background of professional training, in accordance with the characteristics of areas of specialization.VET-TEEN is structured into three general stages:1. Preparation, that consists in the selection of participants and organization of preliminary meetigsThe preparation of the participants is structured in a minimum of 4 meetings during the month preceding each flow starts, in detail:- 2016: from 15/06 to 15/07 for departures scheduled for 15/07; from 15/07 to 15/08 for departures scheduled for 15/08;- 2017: from 15/05 to 15/06 for departures scheduled for 15/06; from 15/06 to 15/07 for departures scheduled for 15/07; from 15/07 to 15/08 for departures scheduled for 15/08The preparatory meetings will address issues relating to risk prevention, intercultural knowledge and deepening linguistic, logistical details.2. Implementation, that is the organization of 215 internships lasting 30 days at partner companies or selected by the intermediaries to carry on at the end of the school year 2015-2016 (86 placements) and the school year 2016-2017 (129 placements).3. Evaluation / Dissemination / Follow up, from October 2017 to May 2018VET-TEEN aims to achieve ambitious learning outcomes which relate to both the formal sphere (language skills and expertise in the sector of integration) as, above all, the life skills (eg. To learn how behave in an organizational/enterprise context, which formal and informal "codes" must be respected, how building up relations with colleagues and superiors, greater awareness of their abilities and limits, gained autonomy in learning doing, relational competence and self-marketing, etc.)The VET-TEEN project will have a significant impact on students participating, the sending organization and the school communities, the host companies and indirect target groups (families, stakeholders). The project will have a major impact in creating a new generation of European citizens, professionals and future entrepreneurs, which implies, in a not too distant future, a greater capacity for the whole of Europe out of the crisis, creating jobs and stimulating innovation and competitiveness.

Learn to Lingo (LtL) will provide mobilities for VET Learners in the vocational field of Teaching English.  Learners will be English teacher trainees and recent (within 1 year of graduating) qualified individuals, placed in 95 day placements, hosted in 8 language academies in Seville in Andalusia, Spain. Our project will last two years. There are three main work aspects to our placements:
1)high quality, full-time, vocational work placements for them to shadow, assist, teach and learn with a mentor (main aspect of the placement)
2)the opportunity to run projects, teach and engage with local people at a community organisation (Trompeta Verde)
3)be part of a group of participants that is across generational (20s-60s) and will exchange learning about their vocation, finding work and other aspects of their lives.

The objectives are:
-For participants to leave LtL better able to secure or create employment in language work
-Inclusion:addressing language needs of all learners+disadvantaged communities across the EU
-To increase skills, generational and cultural interaction and multilinguism in the EU
-Involve and empower participants throughout.

The need for innovative ways to reach and teach all learners but also isolated people and new arrivals means the placement will also provide training for participants to experience a variety of ways of practicing their vocation that they could not get in the UK.  English academies in Andalusia are world class and have particular approaches for LTL participants to bring back to the UK.

We will recruit "for attitude" as well as experience, qualifications and skills and aim for a positive group in each flow who can inspire peer to peer learning.

After recruitment has occurred, LtL takes place over three main stages:
1)Preparation - professional, linguistic and cultural (UK partners with input from Spain partners).
2)VET Placement - orientation, shadowing of staff, assisting then teaching (Spain partners).
3)Aftercare - development of work related skills and post placement opportunities.

Prior to their departure to Spain, participants will benefit from a range of training, information and and systems that aim to help them maximise the outcomes of the placement. Preparation training in London will equip them personally and professionally.

LtL will run exercises and projects to help the different generations on this scheme learn from each other. Sharing participation in this scheme means there will be a cross generational impact with older people on the scheme understanding younger people better and vice versa. They will build relationships with them that are will impact both personally and professionally and can help both in the long term, as mentors, friends or useful contacts. Participants will also work as a group (at Trompeta Verde -with 3Si facilitating) to organise their own weekly community based classes for the disadvantaged (unemployed, migrants). This will broaden their managerial, teaching and entrepreneurial skills. In this way, placements will enable them to gain both vocational and professional skills and develop enhanced intercultural and intergenerational awareness. This will support them in contributing to social inclusion long after the placement has finished.

LtL will support partner organisations in upgrading their management and recruitment systems, refreshing their teaching offer and curricula, develop their partnership and international work and improve staff development. Sustainability is very important to LTL. One of the key ways in which we can have a national impact is firstly through dissemination of results. And secondly through sharing the learning of the teachers. We will work with them during the five flows to create a handbook as well as other materials ('day in the life video', photos etc...) which will share their learning so that it can be passed on to other trainee teachers at the UK consortium members schools but also to other schools and colleges throughout the UK. This toolkit will be an open educational resource.

LtL will support a total of 60 participants in 5 flows of 12 with the first group leaving for Seville in September 2018 and the final group leaving for Seville in January 2020 with the scheme finishing in June 2020.
